message_1: Suppose John runs 5 km every day, starting on January 1st. Using temporal logic, how can we represent the statement "John will run 365 km in a year"?
message_2:
Using temporal logic, we can represent the statement "John will run 365 km in a year" as follows:

Let R(t) represent the proposition "John runs 5 km on day t."

The statement "John will run 365 km in a year" can be represented as:

∑[R(t) * 5] from t=1 to t=365 = 365 * 5

Here, the summation symbol ∑ represents the sum of the distances John runs each day, from day 1 (January 1st) to day 365 (December 31st). The expression R(t) * 5 represents the distance John runs on day t, which is 5 km. The sum of all these distances should equal 365 * 5, which is the total distance John runs in a year (1825 km).
